doc.previous: For a country of its size, Fiji has fairly large armed forces, and has been a major contributor to UN peacekeeping missions in various parts of the world. In addition, a significant number of former military personnel have served in the lucrative security sector in Iraq following the 2003 US-led invasion.[citation needed]
after: Fiji covers a total area of some 194,000 square kilometres (75,000Â sqÂ mi) of which around 10% is land.
